text: hello english language learners welcome
to zen english do you ever feel shy to
start conversations in english do you
want to practice your english with
native english speakers but you don't
know how to start a conversation
well luckily for you i am creating a
whole series of videos on how to start
great conversations in english my name
is amy joy and i will be a guest teacher
here on zen english i have my own
youtube channel called your favorite
english teacher so in this video i will
be giving you 10 questions to start
great conversations at a party or a
social gathering then in the future
videos of this series i will give you
more questions for starting great
conversations at work at school and in
other social situations but for now
let's imagine that you are at a party
and you want to start a conversation
with others in english
so the most common question that you can
ask and be asked is simply what do you
do
or what do you do for work now some
people hate asking this question because
it is almost over asked or asked way too
often and some people also consider it
maybe boring however
asking this question can lead to a lot
of great conversations about other
topics so let me show you a few
follow-up questions to make your
conversation more interesting so after
asking what do you do or what do you do
for work the person might say oh i'm in
sales and then you can respond saying oh
cool what's your favorite part about
your job or oh nice and what do you like
to do outside of work or what do you
like to do for fun so even though the
question what do you do might be boring
or overused it is very useful to know
because one it is natural and so common
for english speakers to use this
question and two it can help you
naturally get into a conversation about
a different topic that is a little bit
more interesting okay and moving on to
question number two how do you know plus
the host's name so this is one of the
most common ways to start a conversation
because you are starting it with
something in common the person who
invited you
somehow you and the person you're
talking to both know the same person so
it's only natural for you to mention
them now some similar questions are do
you know anyone else here and if you're
talking to two friends that already know
each other or a couple you can ask how
do you guys know each other or how did
you two meet all of these questions use
the people around you to be something in
common and this helps you get into a
conversation without feeling like it's
forced or random and another thing that
you will have in common with the people
around you is your location you are all
in the same place so you can ask someone
do you live nearby what do you like
about living here do you have any
recommendations for things to do around
here this opens up an easy conversation
about people's interests and how they
spend their time where they live and if
the person tells you they don't live
nearby then you can ask what brings you
here where do you live or where did you
grow up so asking the question do you
live nearby is a natural question that
uses your location as a point in common
and can help you easily get into the
typical get to know you questions
without feeling awkward or uncomfortable
okay and before moving on to number four
if you have found these questions
helpful so far make sure you like this
video subscribe to zen english and also
subscribe to my channel your favorite
english teacher so you can keep
improving your english with me
okay and moving on to number four have
you been on any trips recently or do you
have any trips coming up this is a fun
question that moves away from the topic
of work and opens up the conversation
for travel stories and any travel plans
you might have and another fun question
is number five is there anything coming
up that you're looking forward to to
look forward to something means to be
excited about something so you're just
asking them if they're excited about
anything coming up there is always a
wedding a birthday an anniversary a
conference or a graduation that people
are planning for and looking forward to
by asking this question many stories and
many different topics of conversation
can be shared for example is there
anything coming up that you're looking
forward to oh actually yeah my brother
is getting married soon and i'm the best
man oh wow how fun do you have to plan
the bachelor party where's the wedding
this small question can go in many
different directions and then you guys
can go and share about all your fun
wedding experiences or conference
experiences or graduation experiences
really the possibilities are endless
which make this a really fun and useful
question to start a great conversation
okay and number six do you have any pets
people love talking about their animals
and if this person says yes you can ask
them to show you pictures most people's
phones are just basically full of
pictures of their dogs so this can be a
really great conversation starter to get
to know someone and some follow-up
questions that go along with this
question include are you a dog or a cat
person being a dog person or a cat
person is a very common expression in
english personally i'm a dog person i
love dogs and i would love to hear from
you are you a dog person or a cat person
let me know in the comments below and if
the person you're talking to doesn't
have pets you can also ask if you had a
pet what would you get this is kind of a
complicated hypothetical conditional
question but really great to discuss all
different types of animals and see what
kinds of animals people like and besides
talking about pets another common topic
we like to talk about is tv and movies
so question number seven is have you
watched any good movies or tv shows
lately this will open up a wide variety
of topics to talk about and you can even
share the things you've been watching
too by saying i've been watching and
then the show i've been watching game of
thrones it's so good or for a movie you
can say i just saw the new batman movie
it was so good now the questions i've
given you so far are great conversation
starters when you're meeting a stranger
or meeting a person for the first time
but sometimes at parties we might see
people that we've already met before but
still don't know very well in this case
you already know a little bit about them
so you might not want to repeat the
questions that i've mentioned above so
here are three more questions for
starting a conversation with an
acquaintance or someone that you have
already met before so question number
eight how have you been notice the
contraction here have often times we do
not say how have you been we just say
have have you been what's new since i
last saw you this is a great general
question that you can ask to catch up
with someone and moving on to question
number nine
think about the last time you saw this
person
is there anything that you can remember
from your previous conversations maybe
they told you they were going on
vacation or going to a conference or
visiting their parents for the holidays
with this in mind you can ask them last
time i saw you you were about to go to
hawaii or a conference or your parents
for the holidays how was that this
really shows that you're a good listener
and interested in what they have to say
and maybe the last time you talked to
this person they mentioned they were
starting a business taking dance classes
getting a master's degree or planning a
wedding try to remember what they were
doing last time and you can ask them how
is x going
how is your business going how are your
dance classes going how is your masters
going how is the wedding planning going
these questions take a little bit more
effort because you have to remember what
the person said last time but they are
great conversation starters for catching
up and checking in now something to keep
in mind with these questions is that it
is very likely the other person will ask
you these questions in return
so in order to build your confidence in
starting these conversations it is so
important that before going to a social
gathering you try to answer all of these
questions for yourself practice your
answers beforehand so that when you get
to the party you feel confident to start
these conversations and if someone asks
you one of these common questions you
are already prepared and confident with
your answer so in order to practice
right now and build your confidence i
want you to choose one of these
questions and answer it in the comments
below i would love to hear from you and
get to know you and also help you
practice your english and if you found
this video helpful make sure you like it
and subscribe to zen english so you get
notified when the rest of the videos in
this series get published and also
subscribe to my channel your favorite
english teacher so you can continue
improving your english and building your
confidence with me
thank you so much for watching this
video i hope you learned something new
and i will see you next time bye
you
